column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////I came here on a Friday evening around 5 pm with one other person. We were told it would be a 25 minute wait
column2: but we were seated about 5 minutes later. We had the option to preorder our pizzas before we were seated
column3: since they take about 30 minutes to make. The personal size was sufficient for each of us. I got the Malnati Chicago Classic; the buttercrust was really good. The cheese and meat slid right off the crust when I cut into it
column4: which made it kind of messy
column5: but it was still very tasty. The service was good although we had to wait a little at first because it was already quite busy. Our server was very nice. When we left around 6 the place was unsurprisingly packed.
